intro: Dodecatheon pulchellum subsp. pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered globemallow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain several small seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
